qas.question: What is another name for classical television transmissions?
Buildings can create ghost images because of what?
What cause less problems in digital terrestrial television?

context: On the other hand, classical (<a0_0>analog<a0_0/>) television transmissions are usually horizontally polarized, because in urban areas buildings can reflect the electromagnetic waves and create ghost images due to <a1_0>multipath propagation<a1_0/>. Using <a2_0>horizontal polarization<a2_0/>, ghosting is reduced because the amount of reflection of electromagnetic waves in the p polarization (horizontal polarization off the side of a building) is generally less than s (vertical, in this case) polarization. <a3_0>Vertically polarized analog television<a3_0/> has nevertheless been used in some rural areas. In digital terrestrial television such reflections are less problematic, due to robustness of binary transmissions and error correction.
